title: Josephine
description: This started out being non-representational, and then I decided to add a figure to it. I am really enjoying using my foam rollers, and of course I added some stenciling to it.

title: Duo
description: This is two abstract figures in their finest red dresses, at a party somewhere fabulous.

title: Threshold
description: This is a figurative piece, with a stylized figure covered with stencils. There is also stenciling in the background and on the curtain. She is transitioning from one area and is poised on the threshold of something new.

title: Timepiece Sonata
description: This started with mark-making in charcoal, then sprayed, and then covered with a dark blue; then the other colors were added on top of that.

title: Tantes
description: I wanted a very tropical feel for this, something playful and whimsical, so I chose very cheerful colors and formed the figures out of areas of stenciling.

title: Tidepool
materials: oil paint and cold wax on cradled board
description: This piece was done with oil paint and cold wax, which is applied to the board with palette knives and scrapers. It is more textural than paint alone and can be scraped off of some areas or splattered with a thinning agent.

title: Ghostflower
materials: oil paint and cold wax on cradled board
description: This is another piece done with cold wax. The raised areas were done by using a stencil.

title: Replicant
description: This entire piece was done by moving one large stencil around the canvas, and changing the colors as I went along.

title: Do You Think So?
description: This was done by focusing on the features of a figure, and trying to keep it as abstract as possible.

title: Entr'acte
description: Here is a glamorous woman, on stage, perhaps. I used my favorite Pyrole red and some stenciling to create the beadwork on her gown.

title: Refractions
description: This is a non-representational piece that sort of developed by itself; I decided to mask off certain areas, and then lighten or darken whatever was next to them to create some contrast.

title: Pink Dragon
description: This was painted as a demonstration on how to use alcohol ink. The color pink is for breast cancer awareness.

title: Intersection
description: This is a small, colorful piece, used to demonstrate the characteristics of alcohol ink.

title: C Minor
description: This started with a charcoal scribble, that was sprayed, and afterward acrylic paint was added to it. It felt musical to me, with the suggestion of a keyboard.

title: Albedo
description: This entire piece was done by moving one large stencil around the canvas, and changing the colors as I went along.

title: Reflection
description: This is a nice little painting, done with some rubber cement resist, and a little bit of stenciling.

title: Oasis
description: This is a colorful little piece with a lot of energy and movement. It was fun to do.

title: Nebula
description: This is a small painting with a limited color palette, that is supposed to convey a feeling of lightness and spaciousness.

title: Family Time
description: This is a cheerful little painting, where the figures have been carved out of a patterned background.

title: Sanctuary
description: My goal with this was to see if I could successfully combine acrylic paint with areas of alcohol ink. I knew that the cells created by the ink would look like bubbles, so I decided on a watery theme, done in blues and greens.
